result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek R. Harvey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  AODA/treatment per agent.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derek R. Harvey in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Derek R. Harvey in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states agreements reached.  Court questions reimbursement of drug buy money.  State responds.  Atty Martinez responds.  Parties are in agreement.  DE is in agreement w/recommendations as read by the State and enters guilty pleas.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  DE advised re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  Victim is present but does not wish to make a statement and hasn't provided a VIS.  State makes statement.  Court explains to the DE his right to a PSI.  DE waives his right to PSI and Atty Martinez is in agreement.  Atty Martinez makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  

16CF157
Cts 1-3, 5, 6:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 4:  Guilty
Probation for one year consecutive to sentence in 15CF193
Conditions of probation:
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
AODA/Treatment
Domestic Violence counseling and any other treatment/counseling per agent

15CF193
Ct 1:  Guilty
5 1/2 yrs prison (2 1/2 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision) consecutive to any other sentence previously imposed
Conditions of extended supervision:
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
AODA/Treatment 
Any other treatment/counseling per agent
DE is eligible for CIP and SAP
Cts 2 and 3:  Dismissed/read-in

15CF404 and 14CF81 are dismissed/read-in
